config.help: Name of your model (only relevant for you to distinguish your recommendations)
Is the ML Model available or only the prediction function?
Does the model solve a classification task?
Are the calibrated probabilities of the classification according to each class returned by the prediction function? (This will only be taken into consideration if it's a classification task)
Are the preprocessing operations (e.g. label encoding, numerical transformations) available and reversible?
How long does it take to access the model or the prediction function? (Important for XAI-method performance)
How high/strong is the correlation of the dataset (considering the number of correlating features and the strength of ALL the correlations)?

How well discretizable are the numerical features? Discretizability is given if the data points of a feature distribution can be divided into intervals of equal size (equal-width binning) with a similar number of data points, or into bins with equal frequency (e.g. deciles/quartiles) with a similar width.
How many features does the dataset have (including One-Hot encoded)? (Important for XAI-method performance)
Which features are likely to offer the potential for discrimination and therefore need special attention (for example 'gender', 'race', 'age')? Please insert them, separated by a ','.

How high/strong is the correlation of the features of interest (taking into account the number and strength of correlations with ALL input features)? This will not be taken into consideration if no Features of Interests are given!

How well discretizable are the numerical Features of Interest? Discretizability is given if the data points of a feature distribution can be divided into intervals of equal size (equal-width binning) with a similar number of data points, or into bins with equal frequency (e.g. deciles/quartiles) with a similar width. This will not be taken into consideration if no Features of Interests are given!
How complex may the calculation of the XAI method be (regarding resource consumption)?
How much time is available for method preparation and familiarization? If 'high' is inserted, effortful methods are not preferred, but are more likely to be considered good.
Does the dataset contain ordinal features?
Are XAI methods preferred that provide local explanations, i.e. that explain the prediction of a specific data instance? (Global methods won't get rated worse)
Are XAI methods preferred that provide global explanations of the entire system, independent of any specific input?
